title: “We’re seeing that the system for watching out for such things is working”—AstraZeneca jab and clots
summary:
Also on the daily podcast: the lasting legacy of a racist 1915 film and a shady history of sunglasses“We’re seeing that the system for watching out for such things is working”—AstraZeneca jab and clotsBRITISH AND European regulators have addressed a possible link with blood clots.
Expect more rare side-effects to emerge; what seems clear for now is that the vaccine’s benefits outweigh any risks.
A new analysis shows that a racist American film from 1915 left a long legacy of racial violence.
And a shady history of the function and fashion of sunglasses.
Runtime: 22minListen on: Apple Podcasts | Spotify | Google | Stitcher | TuneInFor full access to print, digital and audio editions of The Economist, subscribe here www.economist.com/intelligenceoffer
paragraphs: Also on the daily podcast: the lasting legacy of a racist 1915 film and a shady history of sunglasses
“We’re seeing that the system for watching out for such things is working”—AstraZeneca jab and clots

BRITISH AND European regulators have addressed a possible link with blood clots. Expect more rare side-effects to emerge; what seems clear for now is that the vaccine’s benefits outweigh any risks. A new analysis shows that a racist American film from 1915 left a long legacy of racial violence. And a shady history of the function and fashion of sunglasses. Runtime: 22min
